isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND ACCESSORIES - Using Master Diagnostics (MD 32) - Graphic Window and Adding Parameter Identifiers (PID)

svcproc.title: Graphic Window and Adding Parameter Identifiers (PID)
svcproc.para: To monitor the engine parameter data in graphical format, first create a graphical window. This is done similarly to the creation of a Text View window.

step1.para: Select File and then New on the menu bar to open the Select a File Type dialog box.
Select Parameter Graphical View (.pgv) and click OK.

svcproc.para: A generic graphical display window will appear. It will not have any parameters in it . It will display the time axis and the range axis.

step1.para: Beginning with Step 3 in the section Text View and Adding Parameter Identifiers (PID), the procedure to add or delete parameters is the same.

svcproc.para: The Graphical View will now display the selected parameters using their acronyms. Master Diagnostics preselects different colors for each parameter in the order they are added to the window.
Use a Text View window to find the full description for these parameters .
